required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Antidepressant Medication Treatment for Depression in Individuals With Chronic Heart Failure
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Sertraline for Depression CHF

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine the effect of antidepressant medication on rates of death and disease in depressed people with chronic heart failure.

detailed_description.textblock:
Comorbid depression in people with chronic medical illness is a serious public health concern. Depressive disorders lead to increased morbidity, mortality, and poorer outcomes in ischemic heart disease, a leading cause of chronic heart failure (CHF). Evidence suggests that a relationship exists between depression and CHF; studies that examine the way CHF is affected by depression treatments are needed.
Participants in this study will be randomly assigned to receive either sertraline or placebo for 12 weeks. Assessments will be made at Weeks 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12. Participants who do not respond to their treatment will have their medication dose adjusted following assessment. Interviews and rating scales will be used to assess depressive symptoms, cognitive status, psychiatric comorbidity, daily and chronic stress, and social support. A follow-up visit will take place 6 months, 1 year, 2 years, and 3 years after study completion.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Symptoms of Depression in Congestive Heart Failure Patients With Clinical Depression After Treatment With Sertraline or Placebo
primary_outcome.description: Symptoms of depression (as measured by the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, HDRS) in congestive heart failure patients with clinical depression after treatment with sertraline or placebo. The 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) is a rater-administered assessment of depression severity, with total score ranges from 0 (not at all depressed) to 52 (most severely depressed). Change in depression was measured as the difference between the 12-week HDRS scores and the baseline HDRS scores. Thus, a negative value reflects an improvement in depressive symptoms over the 12-week period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Cardiac Events and Morbidity / Mortality, Including Rehospitalization, in Congestive Heart Failure Patients With Depression After Treatment With Sertraline or Placebo.
secondary_outcome.description: Composite cardiovascular scores are calculated for each participant using recorded cardiac events, morbidity/mortality, rehospitalization, and discontinuation due to cardiovascular events. Composite score is compared for sertraline and placebo treatment groups.

arm_group.description: Participants will take sertraline for 12 weeks
Participants will take placebo for 12 weeks

intervention.description: Dosage ranging from 50 mg to 200 mg once a day
Dosage ranging from 50 mg to 200 mg once a day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic heart failure
- Diagnostic and Statistical Manual- Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) criteria for major depression
- Current use of any antipsychotic medication at study entry
Exclusion Criteria:
- Life-threatening comorbidity with a 50% or higher likelihood of death within 1 year
- History of psychoses, bipolar disorder, or severe personality disorder
- History of alcohol or drug dependence in the last year
- Severe physical disability that may interfere with the study
- Neurological impairment
- Active suicidal ideations
- Current use of antidepressant medication(s) at the start of study medication

results_reference.citation: O'Connor CM, Jiang W, Kuchibhatla M, Silva SG, Cuffe MS, Callwood DD, Zakhary B, Stough WG, Arias RM, Rivelli SK, Krishnan R; SADHART-CHF Investigators. Safety and efficacy of sertraline for depression in patients with heart failure: results of the SADHART-CHF (Sertraline Against Depression and Heart Disease in Chronic Heart Failure) trial. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2010 Aug 24;56(9):692-9. doi: 10.1016/j.jacc.2010.03.068.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment began in November, 2003 and concluded in March, 2008. Subjects were recruited from cardiology inpatient units as well as outpatient cardiology clinics.

outcome.title: Symptoms of Depression in Congestive Heart Failure Patients With Clinical Depression After Treatment With Sertraline or Placebo
outcome.description: Symptoms of depression (as measured by the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, HDRS) in congestive heart failure patients with clinical depression after treatment with sertraline or placebo. The 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) is a rater-administered assessment of depression severity, with total score ranges from 0 (not at all depressed) to 52 (most severely depressed). Change in depression was measured as the difference between the 12-week HDRS scores and the baseline HDRS scores. Thus, a negative value reflects an improvement in depressive symptoms over the 12-week period.
outcome.population: Analysis was based on intent to treat (ITT), using random coefficient modeling.

group.title: Sertraline
group.description: Participants will take sertraline for 12 weeks

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants will take placebo for 12 weeks

measure.title: Symptoms of Depression in Congestive Heart Failure Patients With Clinical Depression After Treatment With Sertraline or Placebo
measure.description: Symptoms of depression (as measured by the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, HDRS) in congestive heart failure patients with clinical depression after treatment with sertraline or placebo. The 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) is a rater-administered assessment of depression severity, with total score ranges from 0 (not at all depressed) to 52 (most severely depressed). Change in depression was measured as the difference between the 12-week HDRS scores and the baseline HDRS scores. Thus, a negative value reflects an improvement in depressive symptoms over the 12-week period.
measure.population: Analysis was based on intent to treat (ITT), using random coefficient modeling.

analysis.groups_desc: A hierarchical mixed model was used, analyzing the fixed effects of treatment, the natural log of time, natural log of time squared, the interactions of time and time squared with treatment and site, as well as the random effects of patient, patient-by-time, and square of patient-by-time.

outcome.title: Percentage of Cardiac Events and Morbidity / Mortality, Including Rehospitalization, in Congestive Heart Failure Patients With Depression After Treatment With Sertraline or Placebo.
outcome.description: Composite cardiovascular scores are calculated for each participant using recorded cardiac events, morbidity/mortality, rehospitalization, and discontinuation due to cardiovascular events. Composite score is compared for sertraline and placebo treatment groups.
outcome.population: Analysis was based on intent to treat (ITT).

group.title: Sertraline
group.description: Participants will take sertraline for 12 weeks

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants will take placebo for 12 weeks

measure.title: Percentage of Cardiac Events and Morbidity / Mortality, Including Rehospitalization, in Congestive Heart Failure Patients With Depression After Treatment With Sertraline or Placebo.
measure.description: Composite cardiovascular scores are calculated for each participant using recorded cardiac events, morbidity/mortality, rehospitalization, and discontinuation due to cardiovascular events. Composite score is compared for sertraline and placebo treatment groups.
measure.population: Analysis was based on intent to treat (ITT).

analysis.groups_desc: Tests for differences of proportions were used to examine the composite cardiovascular status outcome at the end of acute treatment. Chi-square tests were used to test for overall treatment differences, with a Mantel Haenszel test performed to examine treatment differences when controlling for clinical site. The primary analyses were conducted on the tri-level cardiovascular status outcome.

reported_events.desc: All participants were followed via phone or mail to ascertain clinical events and vital status every 2 weeks during the 12-week treatment phase. The national death index was used to ascertain vital status of participants who could not be reached via phone or mail.

group.title: Sertraline
group.description: Serious adverse events in Sertraline Arm

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Serious adverse events in Placebo Arm

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: NFS may have limited our ability to detect effect of sertraline on depression scores. Dropout rate was higher than expected. A 12-week duration of therapy may have been insufficient to show potential effects of sertraline on clinical outcomes.
